quotes: Emília Pires was Timor-Leste's Minister of Finance from 2007 to 2015 under the leadership of Prime Minister Xanana Gusmao.

In July 2012, Ms. Pires was appointed by the Secretary-General of United Nations, Ban Ki-moon, to the 26-member High-level Panel of Eminent Persons advising the United Nations on the post 2015 global development agenda.
In 1975 Emilia Pires left Timor-Leste for Australia as a refugee, with her parents, brothers and sisters.
However, exile lasted for 24 years before Pires was able to return to Timor-Leste.
making Timor-Leste one of the top ten fastest growing economies in the world between 2008 and 2011.

quotes: Before becoming Minister of Finance, Ms. Pires held senior positions with the World Bank as Senior Aid Management Specialist in West Bank and Gaza;
